channel.title: NPC Movement & Direction
channel.description:
Hi i have this at the top of my autospawn.cfg
//------NpcID---CoordX--CoordY--Height--RangeX1-RangeY1-RangeX2-RangeY2-WalkType-Descrption
However i do not understand what these mean.
RangeX1-RangeY1-RangeX2-RangeY2
Can anybody help me I think there to do with the npc movement and direction but i'm not sure.

item.title: NPC Movement & Direction
item.dc:creator: @mad_moparscapian mad_moparscapian
item.description:
@mad_moparscapian wrote:

[quote=“Pray for plagues, post:3, topic:273770”]RangeX1-RangeY1-RangeX2-RangeY2
These are the x and y cords that the npc can move. The first set(x1y1) is the northeast coords and set two(x2y2) is the south west coords.[/quote]

Ahh Tyvm i understand now,

Read full topic

item.title: NPC Movement & Direction
item.dc:creator: @Pray_for_plagues Pray for plagues
item.description:
@Pray_for_plagues wrote:

RangeX1-RangeY1-RangeX2-RangeY2

These are the x and y cords that the npc can move. The first set(x1y1) is the northeast coords and set two(x2y2) is the south west coords.

Read full topic

item.title: NPC Movement & Direction
item.dc:creator: @Xaros Xaros
item.description:
@Xaros wrote:

Kk ill show an example [] KK u got a box. Now the “Ranges” r like coords, but they ONLY make the tile walkable for a NPC, every NPC has its own walkable tiles some have only 1. This dose not control theyre movement. Only where they CAN move.

Read full topic
